extendedInfo.description: In European War 3 you will be a commander leading your soldiers to fight for resources, promote economic and industrial growth, develop new technology and seize opposing territory. Whenever deploying army, navy or air force, you need to take much thought due to their strength and weakness. Work on your defenses when you are in a weak position; build airport if you need air support. Fighting the battle could earn your forces experience and when they come to Ace Forces, their combat effectiveness would be impressive! Itâs also important to upgrade your commander level as you would take the lead. European War 3 also gives you a choice among different modes like Empire, Campaign, Conquest and Multiplayer. Empire Mode: conquest among 8 empires with 40 campaigns.[British Empire, German Empire, the United States, Japanese Empire, Qing Dynasty, French Empire and Austro-Hungarian Empire] Campaign Mode: 30 actual historical campaigns (choose any force you like) Conquest Mode: choose any country to compete in Asia, Europe and America for hegemony. Multiplayer Mode: player versus player, available in 1v1, 2v2 or 3v3 format. Features: - 28 command cards make the battle full of change. - 11 forces such as the army, navy and air force all have unique features. - 32 nations are involved across Europe, Asia and America, 1271 administrative regions in total. - Technology reaches up to five levels. - Mini-map display - The map can be zoomed in or zoomed out . - 15 levels of rank promotion (from Private to Field Marshal) - Auto-save

reviews.title: No tutorial.
reviews.comment: For games like this you NEED an interactive tutorial..Been playing for days now and still kinda lost on the game. Still not sure if this is a good game or not
reviews.author: Robert Ross

reviews.comment: Its really fun if you like R.I.S.K or Axis & Allies you would like this game. But one thing I don\'t like about this game is most of the time you lose the battle. But I still like this game one of my favourite.
reviews.author: Jason Zickefoose

reviews.title: Bad, bab, bad....
reviews.comment: I was played for moths in my old iPad. Now with my galaxy note 10.1 has been the first program that I dowload, But it is imposiBle to play, always the game show the map with zoom (only I can see four elements, infatry to artllery, if I want to see the rest I need slide the screen. It\' s imposible a good vision of the countries, only three territories of south of japan and two from korea.   What happen!!
reviews.author: Ricard Carreras

reviews.title: It\'s fine
reviews.comment: But in the middle of the game it keeps on zooming in even though I\'m just using one finger. Please fix this right away for the Note 2.
reviews.author: Norbert Leo Corpuz

reviews.title: \342\230\205 \'\'BANG!\'\'  YOU\'RE DEAD! \342\230\205
reviews.comment: xlnt risk style game - once you\'ve taken the time to fully familiarize yourself with the gameplay you should find it exciting and enjoyable - though i do wish the enemy wouldn\'t come calling when i\'m in the latrine!
reviews.author: skulls crossbones

reviews.title: My Favourite game :)
reviews.comment: it isnt difficult to find out what to do.  And it IS possible to win with the weaker country, for an example British Empire 5. battle(British Empire with a little of Siberia against Russia - east siberia; Japan - Manchuria; Qing Dinasty - China) you can win this battle easily in 13 rounds   The Resolution is low because the developer want that all devices can play this game. On iOS it has a HD version(can be bought together with the normal version) and the resolution of the handy version is higher. And I think this resolution is enough because u r playing a STRATEGY GAME and not games like NFS (sorry but my english isnt really good)  ps: the medals in EW3 can be used only in 1 battle, in WC2 they will be used the whole game
reviews.author: Izdar Abulizi

reviews.comment: A very entertaining game. AI is a bit weak, but for the price it keeps me going and you do have to learn the system at first, so at least for a while it is more challenging. Lots of varied scenarios. Well worth the mini price.
reviews.author: Jonathan Bate

reviews.title: Greatbut
reviews.comment: Please easytech,add an sd card option.fantastic game and wish I could purchase more but just havent got the phone space
reviews.author: John Wadsworth

reviews.title: Cool but frustrating
reviews.comment: This game is cool but SOO ridiculously hard.  You can hold out for a while but then invariably you will be overrun.
reviews.author: Jason Basile

reviews.title: Great Risk-style gameplay, but needs a polish
reviews.comment: A great game that plays well, but blurry low-res graphics throughout. This is a real shame as the design and art assets are inspired. As others have pointed out,  many aspects of gameplay that are not mentioned or explained in the rules. And the rules themselves aren\'t really in English. 5 stars when HD: I\'ll work the rules out by trial and error.
reviews.author: Simon Redgrave

reviews.title: what an amazing game
reviews.comment: I am an up-and-coming history major, and let me just say this game brings me to tears over the historical values it has, thank you so very much!
reviews.author: Stone Duro.

reviews.title: Might be better if i knew what was going on
reviews.comment: This game has a lovely presentation, but is plagued by opaque rules which are not explained in the tutorial, and a non-interactive tutorial which simply gives one a vague overview of the game. Once it\'s time to play, one has to figure out most of it himself, which makes strategizing extremely difficult to do. Additionally, the text is sometimes confusing (it was obviously not written by a native english speaker), giving a slightly less-than-professional feel to an otherwise beautiful interface. After playing for about an hour, i still have little idea how the combat system actually works (sure, i can partake in combat, but don\'t have any feel whatsoever for what the outcome of a battle will be, so i\'m not a terribly effective commander!). i\'m quite certain that this game is much more fun once one figures out how exactly the mechanics work, but i\'m not willing to invest so much time in figuring all that out for myself - the tutorial should have _walked_ me through that info rather than just providing me with a few non-interactive/read-along screens which don\'t explain the basic things like how to deploy troops.
reviews.author: Stephan Beal

reviews.title: Vast improvements
reviews.comment: I love this game! They fixed just about everything i loathed about EW 2. Highly detailed, fun to play, and believable battle outcomes. Well done.  Definately worth the money, also like that they dont shove in-app purchases in your face at every turn.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I imagine there might be a good game somewhere here
reviews.comment: But the tutorial is near useless and other resources on how to play are scant.  The verbiage also suffers from awful localization, which while initially amusing, eventually becomes annoying.  This is a shame because otherwise it would be a polished offering.  As is, an inscrutable disappointment.
reviews.author: Joe Loutzenhiser

reviews.title: GREAT GAME! WORTH THE DL
reviews.comment: You guys have done well with number 3. Changed alot of things to make the game better, such as units have health so they are valued better. and a unit with one troop left cant survive againts 5, which was a big problem in number 2. the introduction of industry points aswell is a good addition. having a general which u can upgrade with medals is good and u can use him in battle for one of your units. the medals are easy to collect and dont require the player to hav to buy them unless they want too. good job
reviews.author: CoLLO LANGY

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.comment: You probably wont find a better game of this genre for android. However it would be nice to see in european war 4 or even perhaps a future update to have the option to ally with other countries and trade etc etc, just add a bit more intensity to the game :) i still love this nonetheless
reviews.author: Tom Archer

reviews.title: Immersive game but has some probs
reviews.comment: Developer please take note! I just paid for this game last week. Firstly, game sometimes crashes when AI is about to attack. I have to wait about 4-5 mins for it to return to my android home menu when this happens. Has happened 5 times already. Secondly, the gold medals go missing in next mission. This usually happens when I restart the level and find that the gold spent on improvement is gone AND no improvements recorded. Once these are fixed it would be an incredible game - even though it is one of the priciest on Google play. I was tempted to purchase medals but then this problem started. Not very confident now! Would rate 5 stars if not for problems. Motorola Xoom.
reviews.author: Ariff Wm

reviews.title: Best strategic game on the Android platform
reviews.comment: The game is what every Risk, history, Civilization and Age of Empires lover would enjoy. It has good historical background, it is easy to pick up and the AI is good. The game has been what I have expected Android developers to do for ages. Really addictive, have spent lot of time on it. Great job!  What I would add to the game is:  1. Diplomacy, when I attack my allies they should turn against me  2. Small historical Wiki that would additionally make the experience of the history lovers even greater  3. The addition of some functionality for multiple units (let us say \"art of defense\") is too much tapping, make the interface better.   4. Add numerical value to the health  5. Make some research time dependable not only money dependable (money can speed up the research)  6. Experience points from campaigns do not add up to the total experience  7. Make some of the units country specific  8. Touch sometimes is not working correctly (zooming when I want to move)  9. Add mode when user does not have good mode (see everything, know everything)   Can\'t wait to see a game in the period from Peter the 1st to Napoleon era, the Colonization and the Boston tea party.
reviews.author: Stefan MIteski

reviews.title: Ok..
reviews.comment: Good game at first, though after 15 mins it get boring, no real depth e.g diplomacy, the economy is pretty basic... Basically, if you\'re the weaker country at the start of the game, you\'ll never beat your opponent.. Fix it up!
reviews.author: Hakan Demirci

reviews.title: How great...
reviews.comment: What an addictive game... my wifes not gonna like me soon. Very intuitive controls.... i just picked it up and kind of knew exactly what i was doing... Only fault i can find is, sometimes a glitch happens where you cant pinch zoom or pan the screen. But pause and resume fixes its. But everything a phone game should be. Gs3
reviews.author: fevzi ozalcin
